name: Sorcerer
description: Sorcerers carry a magical birthright conferred upon them by an exotic bloodline, some otherworldly influence, or exposure to unknown cosmic forces. One can’t study sorcery as one learns a language, any more than one can learn to live a legendary life. No one chooses sorcery; the power chooses the sorcerer.

traits.name: Starting Proficiencies
traits.description: As a Sorcerer, you are proficient with certain weapons. Your saving throw proficiencies are Constitution and Charisma. You are also proficient in two skills of your choice.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: An event in your past left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic fuels your spells. Charisma is your spellcasting ability. You can use an arcane focus.

features.name: Sorcerous Origin
features.description: Choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source of your innate magical power. This choice grants you features at 1st, 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

features.name: Font of Magic
features.description: You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself, represented by sorcery points. You can use these points to gain additional spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain sorcery points.

features.name: Metamagic
features.description: You gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs. You gain two Metamagic options of your choice.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Sorcerous Origin.

features.name: Metamagic
features.description: You gain one additional Metamagic option of your choice.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement

features.name: Sorcerous Restoration
features.description: You regain 4 expended sorcery points whenever you finish a short rest.

subclasses.name: Draconic Bloodline
subclasses.description: Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors.

features.name: Dragon Ancestor
features.description: Choose one type of dragon as your ancestor. The damage type associated with each dragon is used by features you gain later. You can speak, read, and write Draconic.

features.name: Draconic Resilience
features.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1 for each sorcerer level. Additionally, when you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

features.name: Elemental Affinity
features.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage of your ancestry's type, you can add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll. You can also spend 1 sorcery point to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 hour.

effects.condition: on one damage roll of a spell of your chosen ancestry type

features.name: Dragon Wings
features.description: As a bonus action, you can sprout a pair of dragon wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed for 1 minute.

features.name: Draconic Presence
features.description: As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to exude an aura of awe or fear to a distance of 60 feet for 1 minute.

effects.name: Draconic Presence
effects.description: Exude an aura of awe or fear

subclasses.name: Wild Magic
subclasses.description: Your innate magic comes from the forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation. This magic churns within you, waiting for any outlet.

features.name: Wild Magic Surge
features.description: Once per turn, the DM can have you roll a d20 immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect.

features.name: Tides of Chaos
features.description: You can gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Any time before you regain this feature, the DM can have you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, after which you regain use of this feature.

features.name: Bend Luck
features.description: When another creature you can see makes a roll, you can use your reaction and spend 2 sorcery points to roll 1d4 and apply the number as a bonus or penalty to the creature’s roll.

features.name: Controlled Chaos
features.description: Whenever you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, you can roll twice and use either number.

features.name: Spell Bombardment
features.description: When you roll damage for a spell and roll the highest number possible on any of the dice, you can roll it again and add that roll to the damage. You can use this feature only once per turn.

effects.name: Spell Bombardment
effects.description: Reroll one maxed damage die once per turn

subclasses.name: Aberrant Mind
subclasses.description: An alien influence has wrapped its tendrils around your mind, giving you psionic power.

features.name: Telepathic Speech
features.description: You can form a telepathic connection with one creature you can see within 30 feet, allowing you to speak telepathically.

features.name: Psionic Sorcery
features.description: When you cast any of your psionic spells, you can cast it by spending sorcery points equal to the spell's level, rather than a spell slot, and without verbal or somatic components.

features.name: Psychic Defenses
features.description: You gain resistance to psychic damage and have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

features.name: Revelation in Flesh
features.description: You can spend sorcery points to magically transform your body, gaining benefits like a swimming or flying speed, the ability to see invisible creatures, or to alter your form.

features.name: Warping Implosion
features.description: As an action, you can teleport to a space you can see and cause creatures of your choice to make a Strength saving throw or take 3d10 force damage and be pulled toward the space you left.

subclasses.name: Clockwork Soul
subclasses.description: The cosmic force of order has suffused you with magic from a realm like Mechanus.

features.name: Restore Balance
features.description: As a reaction, when a creature you can see is about to roll with advantage or disadvantage, you can prevent the roll from being affected by either.

features.name: Bastion of Law
features.description: You can expend sorcery points to create a magical ward that reduces damage taken by you or a creature you can see. The ward is a pool of d8s you can use to reduce incoming damage.

features.name: Trance of Order
features.description: As a bonus action, you can enter a state where attack rolls against you can't have advantage, and you treat any d20 roll you make for an attack, ability check, or saving throw as a 10 if it's lower. This lasts for 1 minute.

features.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
features.description: You can summon spirits of order in a 30-foot cube. This effect can restore hit points to creatures, repair damaged objects, and end spells of 6th level or lower on targets of your choice.

subclasses.name: Divine Soul
subclasses.description: Your innate magic comes from a distant but powerful familial connection to a divine being.

features.name: Divine Magic
features.description: Your link to the divine allows you to learn spells from the cleric spell list. You also learn one additional spell based on your alignment.

features.name: Favored by the Gods
features.description: If you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can roll 2d4 and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome. Usable once per short or long rest.

features.name: Empowered Healing
features.description: When you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to determine the number of hit points a spell restores, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once.

features.name: Otherworldly Wings
features.description: As a bonus action, you can manifest a pair of spectral wings that last until you're incapacitated or dismiss them. You gain a flying speed of 30 feet.

features.name: Unearthly Recovery
features.description: As a bonus action when you have fewer than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. Usable once per long rest.

subclasses.name: Shadow Magic
subclasses.description: Your innate magic comes from the Shadowfell itself. The power of shadow magic casts a strange pall over your physical presence.

features.name: Eyes of the Dark
features.description: You have darkvision to a range of 120 feet. You also learn the darkness spell, which you can cast by spending 2 sorcery points or a spell slot. If you cast it with sorcery points, you can see through it.

features.name: Strength of the Grave
features.description: When damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Charisma saving throw (DC 5 + damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. Usable once per long rest.

features.name: Hound of Ill Omen
features.description: You can spend 3 sorcery points to summon a hound of shadow to harry a target. The hound has statistics, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws against any spell you cast while the hound is nearby.

features.name: Shadow Walk
features.description: As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see in dim light or darkness.

features.name: Umbral Form
features.description: As a bonus action, you can spend 6 sorcery points to transform into a shadow form. You gain resistance to all damage except force and radiant, can move through other creatures and objects, and have advantage on Strength saving throws.

subclasses.name: Storm Sorcery
subclasses.description: Your innate magic comes from the power of elemental air.

features.name: Wind Speaker
features.description: You can speak, read, and write Primordial.

features.name: Tempestuous Magic
features.description: As a bonus action, you can fly up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks after casting a 1st-level or higher spell.

features.name: Heart of the Storm
features.description: You gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. When you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can cause a damaging aura to erupt from you, dealing damage to creatures within 10 feet.

features.name: Storm Guide
features.description: As an action, you can stop rain from falling in a 20-foot-radius sphere or cause it to start. As a bonus action, you can change the direction of the wind within 100 feet.

features.name: Storm's Fury
features.description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal lightning damage to the attacker and push them away.

features.name: Wind Soul
features.description: You gain immunity to lightning and thunder damage and a magical flying speed of 60 feet. You can also grant a flying speed to a number of allies.
